property.name: Skill Icons
property.value: ήά

property.name: Text
property.value:
You have two additional hand slots, which can only be used to hold Weapon assets.
While you have Weapon assets held in 2 or more hand slots, you get +1 ά.

property.name: Skill Icons
property.value: ίή

property.name: Traits
property.value: Item. Weapon. Melee.

property.name: Text
property.value: η: Fight. You get +2 ή for this attack. If you perform this attack againt an enemy engaged with another investigator, you deal +1 damage for this attack if you succeed, and no damage if you fail.

property.name: Skill Icons
property.value: έά

property.name: Text
property.value:
Play only if there is a clue on your location.
Draw three cards.

property.name: Subtitle
property.value: Empowering Elixir

property.name: Skill Icons
property.value: έέ

property.name: Traits
property.value: Item. Science.

property.name: Text
property.value:
You can only include this asset in your deck by upgrading it from Strange Solution (Unidentified), and only if you have "identified the solution" in your Campaign Log.
Uses (3 supplies).
η Spend 1 supply and exhaust Strange Solution: Choose an investigator at your location to gain 2 resources and draw 1 card.

property.name: Skill Icons
property.value: έέά

property.name: Traits
property.value: Supply. Illicit.

property.name: Text
property.value:
Choose an asset controlled by an investigator at your location. Either (choose one):
- Place 2 ammo or supply tokens on that asset and draw 1 card.
- Double the number of ammo or supply tokens on that asset.

property.name: Skill Icons
property.value: ίίέ

property.name: Text
property.value:
Fast. Play when an enemy enters your location.
Immediately move to a connecting location. (The enemy still enters your previous location.)

property.name: Skill Icons
property.value: έ

property.name: Text
property.value:
Uses (3 charges).
η Spend 1 charge: Investigate. Investigate using ά instead of έ. You get +2 ά for this test. If you succeed you discover 1 additional clue at this location. If a α, β, γ, δ, or ζ symbol is revealed during this test, after this test resolves lose all remaining actions and immediately end your turn.

property.name: Skill Icons
property.value: άά

property.name: Text
property.value:
Uses (4 charges).
η Spend 1 charge: Heal 2 horror from among investigators at your location.

property.name: Skill Icons
property.value: ίήή

property.name: Text
property.value:
Fast. Play after you fail a skill test by 3 or less while attacking an enemy.
Deal this attack's damage to any enemy at your location. If the attacked enemy is engaged with another investigator, this attack deals no damage to that investigator.

property.name: Skill Icons
property.value: ΰΰ

property.name: Text
property.value:
Commit only to a skill test you are performing, and only if the difficulty of that test is higher than your base skill value.
Rise to the Occasion gets +X ΰ icons, where X is the difference between your base skill and this test's difficulty (to a maximum of +3 ΰ icons).

property.name: Subtype
property.value: Basic Weakness

property.name: Traits
property.value: Pact. Mystery.

property.name: Text
property.value: Revelation - Draw the top card of your deck. If it is not a weakness, remove that card from the game. Then, search your deck, discard pile, hand, and all play areas for each other copy of that card you own, and remove them from the game, as well.

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: Return to Extracurricular Activities

property.name: Text
property.value:
Perform the setup as indicated in The Dunwich Legacy Campaign Guide, with the following exceptions:
- When gathering encounter sets, also gather the new encounter sets for Return to Extracurricular Activities shown here.
(Continued on reverse side.)

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: Return to Extracurricular Activities

property.name: Text
property.value:
- Randomly choose between Orne Library and Warren Observatory. Put the chosen location into play, along with the rest of the starting locations. Remove the other location from the game.
- If you have completed Return to The House Always Wins, search the encounter sets for 1 copy of Enthralled Security Guard, and spawn it at the Administration Building.

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: Return to Extracurricular Activities

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: Return to Extracurricular Activities

property.name: Clues
property.value: 1π

property.name: Text
property.value: Forced - After you discover 1 or more clues at Warren Observatory: Discard 3 cards from the top of your deck for each clue just discovered.

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: Return to Extracurricular Activities

property.name: Traits
property.value: Humanoid. Abomination.

property.name: Text
property.value:
Hunter. Retaliate.
Forced - After Enthralled Security Guard attacks you: Discard the top 2 cards of your deck.
Forced - After Enthralled Security Guard is evaded: It is defeated.

card.name: Return to The House Always Wins

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: Return to The House Always Wins

property.name: Text
property.value:
Perform the setup as indicated in The Dunwich Legacy Campaign Guide, with the following exceptions:
- When gathering encounter sets, also gather the new encounter sets for Return to The House Always Win shown here.
(Continued on reverse side.)

alternate.name: Return to The House Always Wins

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: Return to The House Always Wins

property.name: Text
property.value:
- Set the Clover Club Stage aside, out of play.
- Choose one of the two Clover Club Lounge locations at random. Put the chosen location into play along with the rest of the starting locations. Remove the other version of Clover Club Lounge from the game.

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: Return to The House Always Wins

property.name: Traits
property.value: Clover Club.

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: Return to The House Always Wins

property.name: Traits
property.value: Clover Club.

property.name: Text
property.value:
Forced - After Clover Club Lounge is revealed: Put the set-aside Clover Club Stage into play.
While it is Act 1, Clover Club Lounge gains: "η: Look at the top card of your deck. If it is an Ally asset, you may put it into play. Otherwise, draw it. (Limit once per round.)"

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: Return to The House Always Wins

property.name: Traits
property.value: Clover Club.

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: Return to The House Always Wins

property.name: Traits
property.value: Clover Club.

property.name: Text
property.value: Clover Club Bar is connected to Clover Club Stage.

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: Return to The House Always Wins

property.name: Text
property.value:
Surge.
Revelation - Each player who has "cheated" must lose 2 resources and take 1 damage.

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: Return to The House Always Wins

property.name: Text
property.value:
Revelation - You must (choose one):
- Remember that you have "cheated."
- Lose 5 resources.
- Put Raise the Stakes into play in your threat area. It gains: "Each Criminal enemy at your location loses aloof. If it is Act 2 or 3, each Criminal enemy engaged with you gets +1 fight and +1 evade."

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: Return to The Miskatonic Museum

property.name: Text
property.value:
Perform the setup as indicated in The Dunwich Legacy Campaign Guide, with the following exceptions:
- When gathering encounter sets, also gather the new encounter sets for Return to The Miskatonic Museum shown here.
(Continued on reverse side.)

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: Return to The Miskatonic Museum

property.name: Text
property.value:
- Before creatng the "Exhibit Deck," add the 2 new Exhibit Hall locations to the original 6 Exhibit Hall locations. Set Exhibit Hall (Restricted Hall) aside and randomly remove 2 Exhibit Hall locations from the game. Then, continue creating the Exhibit Deck as normal.
For the duration of this scenario, the following additional rule applies:
"While an investigator is resolving the text on agenda 1b and agenda 2b, the Forced ability on the next agenda in the agenda deck is considered to be active."
Attach this card to the scenario reference card as a reminder.

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: Return to The Miskatonic Museum

property.name: Traits
property.value: Miskatonic. Exhibit.

property.name: Subtitle
property.value: Medieval Exhibit

property.name: Clues
property.value: 1π

property.name: Traits
property.value: Miskatonic. Exhibit.

property.name: Text
property.value: Forced - After you fail a skill test while investigating this location: Take 1 damage.

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: Return to The Miskatonic Museum

property.name: Traits
property.value: Miskatonic. Exhibit.

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: Return to The Miskatonic Museum

property.name: Subtitle
property.value: The Archives

property.name: Traits
property.value: Miskatonic. Exhibit.

property.name: Text
property.value: η η: Gain 2 clues (from the token bank). Then, if Hunting Horror is in play, place 1 resource on Shadow-spawned. Otherwise, search the encounter deck, discard pile, and the void for Hunting Horror and spawn it in the Museum Halls. Shuffle the encounter deck.

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: Return to The Miskatonic Museum

property.name: Text
property.value:
Revelation - Attach Dark Bidding to Hunting Horror, even if it is out of play. Dark Bidding remains attached to Hunting Horror if it enters the void.
Forced - When Hunting Horror attacks an investigator: That investigator must take 1 additional damage and 1 additional horror. Heal 2 damage from Hunting Horror. Discard Dark Bidding. (Max once per attack.)

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: Return to The Miskatonic Museum

property.name: Text
property.value: Revelation - Place 1 resource on Shadow-spawned, even if it is out of play.

card.name: Return to The Essex County Express

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: Return to The Essex County Express

property.name: Text
property.value:
Perform the setup as indicated in The Dunwich Legacy Campaign Guide, with the following exceptions:
- When gathering encounter sets, also gather the new encounter sets for Return to The Essex County Express shown here.
(Continued on reverse side.)

alternate.name: Return to The Essex County Express

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: Return to The Essex County Express

property.name: Text
property.value:
- Remove Agenda 1a - "A Tear in Reality," from the game and replace it with the new Agenda 0a - "Where There's Smoke" and the new agenda 1a - "A Tear in Reality (v.II)." (When you construct the agenda deck, agenda 0a should be on top.)
- When choosing 6 Train Car locations to put into play at random, include the 2 new Train Car locations in this encounter set, for a total of 10 possible cards.
- When choosing an Engine Car location to put into play at random, include the new Engine Car location in this encounter set, for a total of 4 possible cards.
Set the Engineer story asset aside, out of play.

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: Return to The Essex County Express

property.name: Encounter Set

property.value: Beast from beyond the Gate

property.value: ο

property.name: Traits
property.value: Monster. Elite.

property.name: Text
property.value:
Spawn - Leftmost location.
Hunter. Massive.
Forced - When The Conductor is defeated: Attach it to the current agenda. After you advance the attached agenda, draw The Conductor.
Forced - When The Conductor's location leaves play: Instead of discarding The Conductor, move it one location to the right.

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: Return to The Essex County Express

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: Return to The Essex County Express

property.name: Text
property.value:
Remove the leftmost location from the game (or place it in the victory display if it has Victory X and no clues on it). Each investigator at that location is defeated. Each enemy and asset at that location is discarded.
Discard all clues controlled by the investigators.

property.value: Return to The Essex County Express

property.value: 2π

property.name: Text

Engine Car is connected to the location to the left of it.
You cannot enter Engine Car unless all of the clues on the location to its left have been discovered.

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: Return to The Essex County Express

property.name: Text
property.value:
Train Car is connected to the locations to the left and right of it.
You cannot enter Train Car unless all of the clues on the location to its left have been discovered.

property.value: Return to The Essex County Express

property.name: Clues
property.value: 2π

property.value: Return to The Essex County Express

property.name: Text
property.value:
Train Car is connected to the locations to the left and right of it.

property.value: Return to The Essex County Express

property.name: Traits
property.value: Ally. Bystander.

property.name: Text
property.value:
η If Engineer is ready: Parley. Test ά or έ (4). If you succeed, take control of Engineer. If you already control Engineer, discover 1 clue from your location instead. Any investigator at Engineer's location may trigger this action.
Forced - When Engineer would be discarded: Instead, heal all damage and horror from it, lose control of it, and exhaust it.

card.name: Return to Blood on the Altar

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: Return to Blood on the Altar

property.name: Text
property.value:
Perform the setup as indicated in The Dunwich Legacy Campaign Guide, with the following exceptions:
- When gathering encounter sets, also gather the new encounter sets for Return to Blood on the Altar shown here.
- Set each copy of Hired Gun aside, out of play.
- Remove the original Village Commons location from the game and replace it with the new Village Commons (Silent Decay).
(Continued on reverse side.)

alternate.name: Return to Blood on the Altar

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: Return to Blood on the Altar

property.name: Text
property.value:
- Add the new locations to the original locations from the Blood on the Altar encounter set. Remove 1 of the 3 copies of each of these locations from the game at random. Then, choose 1 of the 6 remaining locations at random and remove it from the game as well. Put the remaining locations into play.
- When placing encounter cards underneath locations, do not include the 6 cards from the Naomi's Crew encounter set.
- Check Campaign Log. If the O'Bannion gang has a bone to pick with the investigators: Spawn one set-aside Hired Gun at one of the locations not connected to Village Commons. Shuffle the other set-aside Hired Gun into the encounter deck.

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: Return to Blood on the Altar

property.name: Traits
property.value: Dunwich. Central.

property.value: Silent Decay

property.name: Traits
property.value: Dunwich. Central.

property.name: Text
property.value:
Each investigator at Village Commons cannot take draw or resource actions.
η: Resign. "This is suicide! We're better off hiding out the night."

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: Return to Blood on the Altar

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: Return to Blood on the Altar

property.name: Text
property.value:

θ If there are no clues here: Draw the encounter card underneath Bishop's Brook. (Group limit once per game.)

θ If there are no clues here: Draw the encounter card underneath Congregational Church. (Group limit once per game.)

property.value: Return to Blood on the Altar

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: Return to Blood on the Altar

property.name: Text
property.value:
Forced - After you discover a clue from this location: Search the encounter deck and discard pile for a copy of Servant of Many Mouths and draw it. Shuffle the encounter deck.
θ If there are no clues here: Draw the encounter card underneath Schoolhouse. (Group limit once per game.)

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: Return to Blood on the Altar

property.name: Traits
property.value: Humanoid. Criminal. Syndicate.

property.name: Text
property.value:
Each Criminal enemy (including Hired Gun) gains: "Hunter. Prey - Most resources."
Each copy of Hunted Down gains peril and surge.

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: Return to Undimensioned and Unseen

property.name: Text
property.value:
Perform the setup as indicated in The Dunwich Legacy Campaign Guide, with the following exceptions:
- When gathering encounter sets, also gather the new encounter sets for Return to Undimensioned and Unseen shown here.
(Continued on reverse side.)

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: Return to Undimensioned and Unseen

property.name: Text
property.value:
- Remove 4 copies of Brood of Yog-Sothoth from the original scenario and replace them with the 4 new versions of Brood of Yog-Sothoth from the Return to Undimensioned and Unseen encounter set.
For the duration of this scenario, the following additional rule applies:
"If a Brood of Yog-Sothoth would be put into play, it is chosen at random from among the set-aside versions of Brood of Yog-Sothoth."
Attach this card to the scenario reference card as a reminder.

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: Return to Undimensioned and Unseen

property.name: Subtitle
property.value: Charging Beast

property.name: Traits
property.value: Monster. Abomination.

property.name: Text
property.value:
Massive.
Brood of Yog-Sothoth gets +1 π health and cannot be damaged or attacked except using the ability on Esoteric Formula.
Forced - After Brood of Yog-Sothoth moves for the first time each round, if it is unengaged: It immediately moves again toward a random location.

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: Return to Undimensioned and Unseen

property.name: Subtitle

property.name: Traits
property.value: Monster. Abomination.

property.name: Text
property.value:
Massive.
Brood of Yog-Sothoth gets +2 π health and cannot be damaged or attacked except using the ability on Esoteric Formula.

Massive. Retaliate.
Brood of Yog-Sothoth gets +1 π health and cannot be damaged or attacked except using the ability on Esoteric Formula.

property.value: Return to Undimensioned and Unseen

property.name: Subtitle
property.value: Amorphous Terror

property.name: Traits
property.value: Monster. Abomination.

property.name: Text
property.value:
Massive. Retaliate.
Brood of Yog-Sothoth gets +1 π health and cannot be damaged or attacked except using the ability on Esoteric Formula.
Forced - After Brood of Yog-Sothoth enters your location, or vice versa: Test ά (3). If you fail, take 1 horror.

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: Return to Undimensioned and Unseen

property.name: Text
property.value:
Surge.
Revelation - Attach to a Brood of Yog-Sothoth enemy in play without a copy of Imperceptible Creature attached. Remove 1 clue from that enemy.
Attached enemy gains Elite.

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: Return to Where Doom Awaits

property.name: Text
property.value:
Perform the setup as indicated in The Dunwich Legacy Campaign Guide, with the following exceptions:
- When gathering encounter sets, also gather the new encounter sets for Return to Where Doom Awaits shown here.
- Set Naomi O'Bannion aside, out of play.
(Continued on reverse side.)

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: Return to Where Doom Awaits

property.name: Text
property.value:
- Replace the original Base of the Hill and Ascending Path with the new Base of the Hill (Warped and Twisted) and Ascending Path (Warped and Twisted).
- Add the new Diverging Path and Altered Path to the original Diverging Paths and Altered Paths. Then, randomly remove 1 of each from the game. (You will remove an additional copy of each during standard setup.)
- Check Campaign Log. If Naomi has your back: Instead of gaining clues from the token bank via the effect from Part 1 in the Campaign Guide, the lead investigator may choose an investigator to add the set-aside Naomi O'Bannion to his or her deck. This card does not count toward that investigator's deck size.

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: Return to Where Doom Awaits

property.name: Traits
property.value: Dunwich. Sentinel Hill.

property.value: Return to Where Doom Awaits

property.value: Warped and Twisted

property.value: Dunwich. Sentinel Hill.

property.name: Text
property.value:
Base of the Hill is connected to each copy of Diverging Path.
Forced - After you discover 1 or more clues from Base of the Hill: Spend those clues and put that many random set-aside Diverging Path locations into play.
η: Resign. "This is more than I signed up for!"

property.value: Return to Where Doom Awaits

property.value: 1π

property.name: Text
property.value: Forced - After you reveal Fathomless Lake: If you have 2 or more actions remaining, place 1 doom on the current agenda.

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: Return to Where Doom Awaits

property.name: Subtitle
property.value: Ruthless Tactician

property.name: Unique
property.value: ο

property.name: Skill Icons
property.value: έέήή

property.name: Traits
property.value: Ally. Criminal. Syndicate.

property.name: Text
property.value:
You get +1 έ and +1 ή.
ι When an investigator at your location reveals a non-ζ chaos token during an έ or ή test, exhaust Naomi O'Bannion: Cancel that chaos token and reveal a new chaos token. For the remainder of this test, if another copy of the canceled chaos token is revealed, cancel it and reveal a new chaos token.

card.name: Return to Lost in Time and Space

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: Return to Lost in Time and Space

property.name: Text
property.value:
Perform the setup as indicated in The Dunwich Legacy Campaign Guide, with the following exceptions:
- When gathering encounter sets, also gather the new encounter sets for Return to Lost in Time and Space shown here.
- Set Seth Bishop (Thrall of Yog-Sothoth) aside, out of play.
(Continued on reverse side.)

alternate.name: Return to Lost in Time and Space

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: Return to Lost in Time and Space

property.name: Text
property.value:
- Check Campaign Log. If the Ritual was completed: Replace Act 2a - "Into the Beyond" with the new Act 2a - "Into the Beyond (v. II)" included in this encounter set.
- Replace Agenda 3a - "Breaking Through" with the new Agenda 3a - "Breaking Through (v. II)" included in this encounter set.
- Put the single-sided Realms Beyond location into play and spawn Yog-Sothoth there.

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: Return to Lost in Time and Space

property.name: Text
property.value: Forced - After you are moved to a location by an encounter card effect: Take 1 horror.

alternate.name: The Key and the Gate (v. II)

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: Return to Lost in Time and Space

property.name: Text
property.value: Revelation - Move Yog-Sothoth to The Edge of the Universe (or Another Dimension if The Edge of the Universe is not in play). Remove Realms Beyond from the game and advance to agenda 4a. Ignore the text on Realms Beyond while resolving this ability.

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: Return to Lost in Time and Space

property.name: Text
property.value:
η: Discard the top 3 cards of the encounter deck. Choose a location discarded by this effect and resolve its 'revelation' ability.
Objective - If an investigator enters The Edge of the Universe, advance.

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: Return to Lost in Time and Space

property.name: Text
property.value: Spawn the set-aside Seth Bishop (Thrall of Yog-Sothoth) enemy at The Edge of the Universe.

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: Return to Lost in Time and Space

property.name: Subtitle
property.value: Thrall of Yog-Sothoth

property.name: Unique
property.value: ο

property.name: Health
property.value: 4π

property.name: Traits
property.value: Humanoid. Monster. Abomination. Elite.

property.name: Text
property.value:
Retaliate.
Forced - When Seth Bishop attacks you during the enemy phase: Either move to Another Dimension after this attack, or Seth Bishop deals +2 damage for this attack.
Forced - After Yog-Sothoth enters Seth Bishop's location (or vice versa): Seth is devoured whole. Remove Seth Bishop from the game. Heal 6 damage from Yog-Sothoth.

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: Return to Lost in Time and Space

property.name: Text
property.value:
Yog-Sothoth is immune to player card effects, cannot take damage, and cannot leave Realms Beyond.
As an additional cost for you to leave Realms Beyond, test ά or ί (3). If you fail, cancel the effects of the move.
Forced - When a forced effect would move an investigator or enemy to Another Dimension: Move them here instead. Cannot be canceled.

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: Return to Lost in Time and Space

property.name: Traits
property.value: Otherworld. Extradimensional.

property.name: Text
property.value:
Revelation - Put Indecipherable Stairs into play and discard the top 3 cards of your deck.
Forced - After you leave Indecipherable Stairs: You must either take 2 horror, or discard Indecipherable Stairs.

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: Return to Lost in Time and Space

property.name: Traits
property.value: Otherworld. Extradimensional.

property.name: Text
property.value:
Revelation - Put Towering Luminosity into play and either place 1 doom on it or take 2 damage.
Forced - After you fail a test while at this location: You must either flip 1 clue on Towering Luminosity to its doom side, or discard Towering Luminosity.

property.value: Return to Lost in Time and Space

property.name: Traits

property.name: Text
property.value:
Revelation - Put Unstable Vortex into play and discard 1 copy of Tear Through Space, if able.
Forced - At the end of your turn, if you are at Unstable Vortex: You must either draw the top card of the encounter deck, or shuffle Unstable Vortex into the encounter deck.

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: Beyond the Threshold

property.name: Text
property.value: Revelation - For each card in your hand, if there is a copy of that card in your discard pile, take 1 horror (to a maximum of 3 horror). If you take no horror from this effect, discard the top 3 cards of your deck.

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: Beyond the Threshold

property.name: Text
property.value:
Peril.
Revelation - Choose two of the following actions (investigate, fight, evade, move, or play). For the remainder of the round, each investigator cannot perform each chosen action. If this is not the first copy of A Baleful Welcome drawn this phase, choose three of those actions instead.

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: Beyond the Threshold

property.name: Text
property.value:
Revelation - Attach to your location.
As an additional cost to move into or out of attached location, discard the top card of your deck. If the discarded card is a weakness, draw it. Otherwise, for each copy of the discarded card in your hand or play area, you must either take 1 horror or discard that card.

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: Resurgent Evils

property.name: Text
property.value:
Peril.
Revelation - You must either (choose one):
- Draw the top 2 cards of the encounter deck.
- Place 1 doom on the current agenda. This effect can cause the current agenda to advance.

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: Secret Doors

property.name: Text
property.value:
Revelation - Attach to the location with the most investigators, and without a Secret Door attached.
Investigators cannot leave this location.
η: Test ά (3) to search for the passage or έ (3) to discern the way out. If you succeed, discard Secret Door.

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: Creeping Cold

property.name: Text
property.value: Revelation - Test ί (4). For each point you fail by, you must either choose and discard 1 card from your play area or from your hand, or take 1 damage.

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: Creeping Cold

property.name: Text
property.value:
Revelation - Attach to your location. Limit 1 per location.
Forced - After an investigator at this location draws 1 or more cards, that investigator must test ά (3). If that investigator fails, he or she chooses and discards an equal number of cards.
η η: Discard Oppressive Mists.

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: Erratic Fear

property.name: Text
property.value:
Revelation - Put Violent Commands into play in your threat area.
η: Deal 2 damage to an investigator at your location and discard Violent Commands.
Forced - At the end of your turn: Test ά (3). If you fail, take 1 horror.

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: Erratic Fear

property.name: Text
property.value:
Revelation - Put Idle Hands into play in your threat area.
θ If Idle Hands is in your threat area, during your turn, take 2 damage and discard Idle Hands: You may take an additional action this turn.
Forced - At the end of your turn: Take 1 horror.

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: Erratic Fear

property.name: Text
property.value: Revelation - If you have no clues, Need for Knowledge gains surge. Otherwise, test έ (X), where X equals the number of clues you have (to a maximum of 5). For each point you fail by, you must either take 1 horror or place 1 of your clues on your location.

Hunter.
Forced - At the end of the enemy phase: Each investigator at Vassal of the Lurker's location discards 1 card from the top of his or her deck.

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: Yog Sothoth's Emissaries

property.name: Text
property.value:
Peril.
Revelation - You may draw 1 card. You may choose and discard up to 2 cards from your hand. Test ά (X). If you fail, take 2 horror. X equals the number of cards in your hand when this test begins.
